RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Michelle S. Wangham is a Professor at University of Vale do Itajaн (Brazil) since 2006. She received her M.Sc. and Ph.D. on Electrical Engineering from the Federal University of Santa Catarina (UFSC) in 2004. Recently, she was a Visiting Researcher at University of Ottawa. Her research interests are vehicular networks, security in embedded and distributed systems, and identity management. Dr. Wangham is a consultant of the Brazilian National Education and Research Network (RNP) acting as the coordinator of Identity Management Technical Committee. She has participated in several national/Brazilian and international research projects. Since 2013, she is coordinating the GIdLab project, a Virtual Laboratory for R&D in Identity Management

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: ECOLEAD - European Collaborative Networked Oraganizations Leadership Initiative
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: ECOLEAD aims to create the necessary strong foundations and mechanisms for establishing the most advanced collaborative and network-based industry society. The fundamental assumption in ECOLEAD is that a substantial impact in materializing networked collaborative business ecosystems requires a comprehensive holistic approach. Given the complexity of the area and the multiple inter-dependencies among the involved business entities, social actors, and technologic approaches, substantial breakthroughs cannot be achieved with the incremental innovation in isolated areas. Therefore ECOLEAD addresses the three most fundamental and inter-related focus areas that are the basis for dynamic and sustainable networked organizations: Breeding Environments, Dynamic Virtual Organizations, and Professional Virtual Communities.

Serгo explorados quatro grupos de clientes, sendo necessбrio o desenvolvimento de soluзхes prуprias para cada um dos grupos, os grupos sгo: DNIT (Departamento Nacional de Infraestrutura de Transportes), a qual serб oferecido serviзos de consultoria e levantamentos tйcnicos para a implantaзгo do sistema em territуrio nacional; Montadoras, as quais poderгo utilizar a API de desenvolvimento do Sistema RAMS para implementarem aplicaзхes de seguranзa de forma autфnoma; Concessionбrias, estas poderгo prover planos de comunicaзгo para seus clientes por meio do Sistema RAMS; e por fim, o grupo Condutor, que engloba condutores proprietбrios de veнculos de passeio atй empresas de viaзгo que poderгo usufruir do Sistema RAMS por meio de dispositivos mуveis. Este sistema tem como objetivo aumentar a seguranзa nas autoestradas brasileiras, assim diminuindo o nъmero de mortes e prejuнzos aos cofres pъblicos.
